name: Vietnamese inspired Curried Tofu Summer Bowl
description: Tuck into a Vietnamese inspired Curried Tofu Noodle Bowls - so fresh and delicious. Rice noodles and quick-pickled vegetables topped with pan-fried sweet and salty curried tofu, drizzled with a spicy maple lime dressing. Glutenfree Nutfree!
recipeIngredient: 14 ounces firm or extra firm tofu  (pressed for at least 15 minutes then cubed or sliced into preferred shapes)
1 -2 teaspoon curry powder (use less or more to preference)
1.5 teaspoon soy sauce (use tamari for gluten-free)
3 tablespoons coconut cream (scoop out the thick part of the coconut cream from full fat coconut milk can)
1/2 cup rice wine vinegar  (or use apple cider vinegar or white vinegar)
2 cups thinly sliced vegetables such as carrots (cucumber, radish, red bell pepper, onion)
1 tablespoon sambal oelek  (or Asian chili garlic sauce)
a good pinch of salt and pepper
8 Oz pack cooked vermicelli rice noodles

recipeInstructions.text: Pickle the vegetables: Combine the vinegar, water, salt, sugar in a mason jar and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Pickle the vegetables: Combine the vinegar, water, salt, sugar in a mason jar and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the vegetables and press down so that everything is submerged. close the lid and refrigerate for an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the vegetables and press down so that everything is submerged. close the lid and refrigerate for an hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the curried tofu: Slice the tofu into at least 1/2 an inch thick slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the curried tofu: Slice the tofu into at least 1/2 an inch thick slices.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a cast iron skillet over medium heat or any thick bottom skillet. Add oil and spread.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a cast iron skillet over medium heat or any thick bottom skillet. Add oil and spread.

recipeInstructions.text: When the oil is hot, add the tofu slices carefully. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side so that some of the sides are golden.
recipeInstructions.name: When the oil is hot, add the tofu slices carefully. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side so that some of the sides are golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the sauce ingredients in the coconut cream and add to the pan. Mix and cook until the sauce thickens and coats the tofu.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the sauce ingredients in the coconut cream and add to the pan. Mix and cook until the sauce thickens and coats the tofu.

recipeInstructions.text: Flip the tofu slices midway so that all the sauce coats the tofu evenly. Take off heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip the tofu slices midway so that all the sauce coats the tofu evenly. Take off heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the dressing: Mix all the ingredients in a small bowl until well combined and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the dressing: Mix all the ingredients in a small bowl until well combined and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Assemble your bowls: Add a good helping of lettuce and noodles, and the pickled vegetables to a serving bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble your bowls: Add a good helping of lettuce and noodles, and the pickled vegetables to a serving bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Top it with some of the curried tofu. Add a bit of the dressing and some cilantro and mint. Add your lime wedge and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Top it with some of the curried tofu. Add a bit of the dressing and some cilantro and mint. Add your lime wedge and serve.

recipeInstructions.text: To store, store the tofu, noodles and veggies separately and assemble as needed
